Places around Abu Dhabi

Road Trips
Separated from the other regions in Oman by the eastern coastline of the UAE is the picturesque peninsula, Musandam. The peninsula, with its capital city Khasab, is more of a scenic retreat for travelers who are looking for some fine natural adventures along the lovely mountain side and coast. The capital of the peninsula is known for shopping and food delights in the region with a couple of restaurants and supermarkets. 
Apart from these activities, the peninsula is well known for its water sports and fun recreation centers. 
There are plenty of boats available from Muscat to Khasab which are very affordable and comfortable. Most travelers coming in from Dubai usually prefer driving down to Khasab by taking the northern route leading to Ras Al Khaimah. 
Read More
Musandam , Oman
| 5 hrs 45 mins | 315 Km
Ras Al Khaimah is northernmost emirate in UAE protected by hazy mountains. You can find white sandy beaches and sun-baked deserts in this touristy emirate. In these beautiful destinations you could enjoy multiple activities, like dune dashing, camel riding and water sports too. For history enthusiasts, there are numerous historical sites that narrate stories about the rich heritage of the country. The restaurants promote delicious Indian and Lebanese delicacies. Ras Al Khaimah has its own international airport. To get to the region, it takes about 20 minutes from the city and you could take a cab to get to the city. Taxis, cars, buses are some public modes of transport you could consider using to get around. Budget and luxury accommodation is available. 
Read More
Ras Al Khaimah , UAE
| 2 hrs 34 mins | 255 Km
Al Ain is an Oasis town known as the Garden City due to its lush greenery. It is considered as a breath of fresh air when compared to the other large and populous cities around. It houses the second tallest mountain in UAE, Jebel Hafeet. It has has many amazing museums most famous one being the Al Ain Museum and Fort, built to safeguard the oasis from the raiders. The museum also recreates the way people of this region lived before the founding UAE. Even though it is called a Garden City, the desert is just a drive away. Lebanese and Arabic cuisine are the most famous and cheapest. Restaurants offer generous portions and excellent quality. Al Ain is a 80 minute drive from Abu Dhabi. Taxis are very cheap and are easy to find. Because they are considered unsafe for women, pink taxis with female drivers are available for women. Accommodation is cheap.
Read More
Al Ain , UAE
| 1 hr 50 mins | 173 Km
Hatta is a one-day-visit destination which is just an hour drive away from Dubai. The mot famous place to visit while in Hatta is the Hatta Heritage Village. It is a reconstruction of a traditional mountain village located in Hatta, in the Al Hajar Mountains, Dubai. It has displays on weaponry, local music, palm-tree products, handicrafts, weaving, traditional dress and old village society that illustrate the past. The mosque and the houses dwelling in the village were constructed out of mud, palm tree trunks and fronds, reeds and stones. The village has 30 buildings and some doors are about 2.5 meters above the ground. Guards had to use ropes to climb the distance. It is a one hour drive away from Dubai international airport. Regardless of this you have to carry your passport as you cross the Oman border twice. Taxis are available conveniently in Hatta which will take you around. 
Read More
Hatta , UAE
| 2 hrs 40 mins | 267 Km
View All Road Trips
Sharjah! The third largest city in UAE. In 1998, UNESCO declared it as Arab Capital of Culture. You can start your cultural journey through Sharjah at Cultural Palace Square in Al Wahda Road continue to the Natural History Museum and then head to the Palace of the Sheikh of Sharjah. For a relaxing stop you can stop at Sharjah Cornich. Sharjah Cornich is know for its white beaches. There are Heritage and Arts Areas too which one could explore with admiration for hours. Sharjah city is 15kms from Sharjah International Airport. There are shuttle buses every 30 minutes from the airport to the city. There are public buses that take you around Sharjah. But the historical town is better explored on foot. Budget, mid-range and luxury accommodation is available.
Read More
Sharjah , UAE
| 2 hrs 5 mins | 166 Km
Fujairah is the youngest of the Emirates becoming independent from Sharjah only in 1952. Even though most of the main structures are still under renovation there are a few sights to visit like Fujairah Fort, Al Hayl Fort, Sheikh Zayed Mosque and Fujairah museum. You could either practice some sea activities at the sunny beaches or take a boat trip and visit some islands that lie in the Gulf of Oman. There are hidden beaches you could go to. 
Dibba: The reason people effuse about the coastline between Dibba and Musandam is the hidden beaches that are accessible by hiring a fishing boat or setting out on a 6 hour hike. Al Myam and Haffa are two beaches that cut into the coastline around Zighy Bay. The Al Myam beach is white sanded and surrounded by Hajar mountains. In the palm-fringed Haffa beach dwells a small fishing village. The beaches are excellent for the water sport snorkeling. There are a few resorts surrounded by fine white sand.
Al Aqah: Another hidden beach which is a 20 minute drive from Dibba Beach is the Al Aqah beach. Here there are a few resorts that offer some enjoyable water sports like diving and fly fishing. You could also enjoy camping out at the beaches. 
You can drive from Dubai to get to Fujairah. You can take taxis to get around the city. Budget accommodation are few in number and luxury accommodation is comparatively more in number.
Read More
Fujairah , UAE
| 3 hrs 20 mins | 298 Km
View all road trips from Abu Dhabi
Short Flights
If countries like Egypt, Turkey and others in the Middle-East brim with cultural flavor and heritage, Amman is well known for distinguishing itself as a modern city with free-minded people and a cheerfully electrifying atmosphere. The moment you set foot it the city, you sense its aura. The city is divided into two parts: East and West Amman. While the East is defined by your average conservative and hesitant middle-eastern population, the west is the glittery half of Amman with a joyous atmosphere, spectacular nightlife, classical restaurants, cafes and breathtaking resorts and retreats. These characteristics make Amman a tourism paradise as you get the tempting and majestic feel of the middle-eastern region with an uber-cool modern outlook and appeal that makes your holiday worth the experience. Amman can be reached easily by flight from Dubai or other parts of UAE which takes a maximum of 3hr 35 min to 4hrs to reach the city. 
Read More
Amman , Jordan
| 3 hrs 10 mins
Despite being plagued by the horrific wounds inflicted by the civil war from the 80s all the way into the 21st century, the city has of Beirut has managed to retain it's historical and culture significance over the years. The city's uptown areas, today, are full of lovely tourist attractions which are swarmed by hordes of travelers coming in from overseas every year. Beirut is the commercial and political capital of Lebanon which gives every traveler the experience of a lifetime with it's picturesque beach-side resorts, sprawling international hotels and heritage clubs. A must visit for travelers who are particularly looking for a leisure holiday. The best way of reaching Beirut from Dubai is by taking one of the many flights to Beirut which takes 3hr 30 min to reach the city. 
Read More
Beirut , Lebanon
| 3 hrs 15 mins
A port city that is different from the other major ones across the world. Muscat is unique not only for having culturally adapted to the needs of the 21st century, despite being stubborn about it's historical and cultural preservation, but also because of it's distinctive port side structural architecture as well as the palpable simplicity of it's seaside and central shopping zones. It presents itself through an unbelievable concoction of both traditional and modern styles. Couple this with some world famous continental as well as traditional Omani restaurants and some breathtaking landscapes and you have a fun, frolic and unique experience waiting for you. You can reach Muscat hassle-free from Dubai within 1hr 15 min by air. If you are in for a nice long ride, then the city of Muscat is just 5 hrs away from Dubai. 
Read More
Muscat , Oman
| 1 hr
Serving as Qatar's capital city and economic nerve center, Doha can be termed as one of the most popular places to visit in the Persian Gulf. Not only because of it's spectacular skyline, giving it the look of a major financial hub, but also because of the preservation of it's culture and traditional methods while adapting to the requirements of the 21st century. This well known skyscraper city may not have as many retreats as Dubai but surprises you with a level of entertainment and satisfaction you can get from select few places. Doha international airport is one of the most well-connected in the Gulf with travelers coming in by the thousands from the UAE as well as other countries. If you enjoy road trips, Doha is just 6 hrs away by road and can be easy traveled to from major cities like Dubai and Sharjah. The roadways are well maintained with controlled levels of traffic.
Read More
Doha , Qatar
| 1 hr
View All Short Flights
Salalah is a glowing city mostly known for its beaches. In it dwells a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Al Baleed Archaelogical Site. Enveloping this heritage site are plantations of coconut, papaya, sugar cane and banana. At the beaches, you could try snorkeling and diving or go for a excursion to the cave nearby. Mirbat is a one hour drive away from Salalah and is a good destination for a one day trip. A 90 minutes flight from Muscat will get you into Salalah. There are flights from Dubai, Sharjah, Kozhikode and Doha too. There are taxis to make traveling in the city comfortable. There is mainly budget and mid-range accommodation.  
Read More
Salalah , Oman
| 1 hr 50 mins
A spectacular coastal city with breathtaking beach resorts, splendid nightlife and great cultural diversity that fuels the party and club culture. Manama is quite the place for you if you are the type that enjoys the frolic relentlessness of clubbing and partying with a crowd that's fairly influenced by the modern hip and techno culture. Apart from the party scene, Manama has it's fair share of tourist attractions like mosques, museums and is well known for it's restaurants and shopping zones. The best way to reach Manama from Dubai is by taking a flight which reaches Manama in just 1hr 30 min. Manama can be reached by road as well from Dubai but is nearly 8hr.
Read More
Manama , Bahrain
| 1 hr
